critique:
The document is an executive order focused on providing job opportunities within the Federal Civil Service to individuals who have completed job training programs funded through the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA). It allows executive agencies to give excepted appointments to qualified individuals and potentially convert these appointments to career or career-conditional appointments after a period of satisfactory service. The order emphasizes adherence to Civil Service laws, rules, and regulations, and requires the Director of the Office of Personnel Management to issue guidelines and regulations for implementation. It seems to promote social inclusion by providing opportunities to unemployed or disadvantaged persons. It also involves government intervention in employment and training programs. There is no clear indication of a strong ideological tilt, immigration stance, expansion of executive power, federalism implications, or national security concerns.
